comments.commentBody:
Speaking as a guy with a history degree, certainly not a historian, I see this as a very smart move by the Obama Administration to provide historians of the future, to say nothing of investigators of today, with a protected and clear road to the goings on between Trump staffers and the Russians in 2016. Spreading this information across the governmental landscape was a brilliant move by the Obama staffers.

Again, with a background and huge interest in history, it is hard to contain my enthusiasm for the unfolding of the telling of events associated with the Election of 2016. I believe more than ever that this election of late was crooked as a dog's hind leg; this story, if it proves factual, will confirm my beliefs.

I wait patiently; time will tell.

Spicer is a lair!! Why is Flynn gone then, if there is "no there there" Why are so many of his people tied to Russia? I watched Rachel Maddow connect all the dots oh her show the other night. It was brilliant, and terrifying. http://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow/watch/new-commerce-secretary-at-nexus...

The New Yorker appears to have supplied one piece of the puzzle which makes sense out of the rest.

Yes, Russia was meddling in the US elections. But they, like everybody else, including Donald Trump. thought it beyond reasonable to expect that they could actually tilt the election to Trump. They were as surprised as everyone else about the outcome.

So why were they doing it?

More to discredit and weaken Hillary Clinton after she became POTUS than to dream the impossible dream of getting Trump in the White House.

The best guess is that the Russians intended to just go on using the drip drip drip of leaks damaging to Hillary Clinton in a effort to exacerbate partisan divisions in the US, and thereby weaken Clinton's credibility and leadership authority.

What was in this for Trump if he himself didn't think he could win?

Follow the money!

My theory?

That Trump fully expected to lose the election, but then walk away to go into business deals with the Russians, and wherever else made sense in the Russian Federation.

This was all about Trump Towers in Moscow and St. Petersburg!

Ironically, because he won, Trump will not be able to be there to cut the ribbons, or throw the first shovel of dirt, until January 21, 2021.

Unless of course, John McCain, Lindsey Graham, and one more Republican Senator vote with the Dems to have a full scale investigation of Donald Trump and Associates, leading to impeachment.

Who might that other Senator be?

Can you say Ted Cruz?!

replies.commentBody:
Investigation has already been made, by the FBI no less:

https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/01/us/politics/fbi-russia-election-donal...

Doesn't count until it fits your narrative though, right?

Because we all know the FBI is on top of this under Jeff Sessions, and with Comey under investigation by the Inspector General, right? You misunderstand my point.  The FBI investigates criminal misconduct.  The president could himself put an end to these suspicions for the good of the country by authorizing an independent investigation that would presumably exonerate him and his associates from any cloud of suspicion and yet he does nothing.  Why?  Imagine Clinton was elected and she and her associates faced similar allegations.  What's your position now?  Can't we all agree that even the appearance of impropriety due to apparent connections between our President's associates and the Russians weakens our country?  Don't I as a U.S. Citizen have the right to a definitive answer?

comments.commentBody: Trump has to accept that this question about the connection between his campaign and the Russians isn't going away.  If he doesn't want it to tarnish (and possibly overshadow) his entire tenure as President, he will (1) appoint independent counsel with full powers to investigate his campaign and Russia's meddling in the election, and (2) release his tax returns.  If he fails to do both, and quickly, then we all know what the answer is.

replies.commentBody: Throw Miller in there for me. Thank you.

comments.commentBody: At the very least, Trump, Bannon, and that liar Spicer, should be doing time keeping toilets clean in a federal pen.
We need an independent investigation by a special prosecutor now. And we need to beware of an administration that just may do anything to hold onto power.

replies.commentBody: Please explain to me in detail how Russia has had any influence on our democracy? That is, beyond the veil of self deluded cognitive bias. Thank you.

comments.commentBody: We ultimately may need an Edward Snowden to come forth, an ex-intelligence official who preserved some of this information and is willing to risk leaking it in the name of revealing Russia as a true enemy of our democracy.  In years past, Congress would be all over this with investigations.  Sadly, the current leadership (McConnell and Ryan) are too focused on pushing a Republican policy agenda to authorize proper investigation.
Thank you, New York Times, for another piece of great reporting. Long may you occupy your place in our lives!

When these questions first came up, I asked myself if I would feel differently if it had been a Democratic President with the same issues. I honestly answered, "no." I think a full investigation needs to be done. So should the Republicans, incidentally. How much time and money was wasted on Bengazi?

November's election must be overturned and he Electoral College must step in and name HRC the president based on the popular vote. The Trump administration is clearly not legitimate and did not win legitimately.

Trump said he was going to throw HRC in jail over her private email, and his supporters cheered that. The problem, they said, was that it could have been hacked.
Well, Russia DID hack US email servers and Trump and his supporters suddenly do not care about actual hacking of email servers by a hostile foreign country, and Trump clearly has no interest in investigating for himself what Russia did. It is pretty clear, in fact, that just as with his tax returns, Trump is hiding something, in this case collusion with Russia.
How on earth can we consider the 2016 Election outcome to be legitimate and therefore Trump a legitimate president?
Seems that this 'problem' bears futher investigation...  perhaps 'the donalt will 'go to the window' upon hearing the allure of the siren's song... So say'eth the truth... Come to me

" It is a sad and frightening scenario that an outgoing president has to protect information crucial to our nation's security and integrity from the next president. What does that tell you about Trump and his administration?"

Let's go a little bit further and say what does it tell us about the Republican Party.

The House republicans are actually standing in the way of investigating this possible "Trump Russian Connection" being investigated.

One has to wonder why and what is the republican party trying to hide?

The article states that British and Dutch allies provided information describing meetings in European cities between Russian officials and associates close to Trump.
If correct, the British and Dutch link is strong and Trump's tax returns will connect the dots between the Russians and Trump.
Hopefully, the British and Dutch will reveal what intelligence information they gathered for the sake of American national security and the free world.
Seventeen intelligence agencies agree that Putin's hacking was to undermine Hillary Clinton.
The missing pieces are coming together. But Putin has information about Trump that will be devastating to the GOP which is protecting him, and lead to Trump's impeachment.

So it is a proven fact now - Obama orchestrated disinformation campaign and interfered into election process by intentionally spreading a second hand/grade and low quality analytics to the public? This is a criminal offence as close to Watergate as possible and because it is too late to impeach Obama ,criminal investigation should be  open on him.

Holy moly!
if Obama and the WH were scrambling to preserve evidence and prevent suppression of that evidence -- the logical conclusion is that there IS some "there" there.

I can't believe Trump is that important to the Grand Zero Party plus getting rid of him would probably make their lives a lot easier. Pence can carry out the right wing agenda as well or better than Trump and without the ridiculous, foolish, unstable comments and antics that make Trump entertaining but frightening. The Republicans never wanted him to run to begin with and have zero loyalty toward him.  I say it's a matter of time before they hang Trump out to dry with an investigation to save themselves and let Pence take over. Trump won't be able to lie his way through this one either. He will be disgraced sooner or later. It's coming.

What I hope is that the Fourth Estate will lead this by connecting all the dots. We all want a smoking gun, but what we need is the story with such strong,  overwhelming evidence, there will be no choice but to create justice for US Democracy.

Be warned before continuing to read this comment. This may keep you up at night.
What if, before everything is said and done, republicans hold the house and Trump wins re-election?
Trump and his Administration can try to hide their Russian connections but nothing stays hidden forever. Truth will out.

What are the chances that Obama left this bread trail of false information to derail Trump's presidency.  What about the Chairman of one committee who unequivocally said he has seen no information about contacts between trump or his campaign team.  Isn't odd that a reporter can see information that the chairman of the committee looking into this does not see.  The media is so set on bring down Trump because they cannot believe that the voters would go against the medias' recommendation to vote for Hillary.  Get over it.

"meetings in European cities between Russian officials — and others close to Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin — and associates of President-elect Trump,"

This implies the time period was after the Nov 8, 2016 election and before the inauguration. Why else describe Trump as president elect rather than Mr. Trump or President Trump?
This is extremely damning.

There are a lot of other crowd sourcing sleuths who are still gathering corroborating evidence.

Trump will resign before the 4th of July.

replies.commentBody: Our great friend McConnell blocked that. Obama was too honorable to fight him on it so close to the election.
It's easier to go for the impeachment than to upset the entire election process. A boil is much easier to lance once it has developed fully.

comments.commentBody:
President Obama made 2 big mistakes during his 2 terms..

1. Nominating Jim Comey for FBI Director..

2. Staying silent RE; Trump's ties with Russia before the election..

It is, after all, exactly as it seemed from the beginning. What's missing is the dossier. There was inappropriate and possibly illegal contact between Trumps people and the Russians. Flynn was thrown under the bus and took the very public fall from grace (probably willingly knowing Trump would eventually pardon him) with no protestation or defense other than to confirm he had "mislead Pence". It was all too easy.

Now we have the "pivot" as seen in last nights performance by Trump. It's a well orchestrated attempt to distract the American citizenry and keep them confused. It's akin to a three card Monty. They are basically in the throws of a coverup and, never having done one before, on this scale, hope that something goes their way and the public embraces the "new Trump" and doesn't want to hear about the shady one.

But, in the end,. it's amateur hour. The odds are against him if past behavior is the best predictor of future behavior and Trump is 1 for 300. That is one "presidential speech" to 300 non presidential speeches, tweets, impulsive moves, lies, comments, and a whole host of other dumb stuff. The Russian stuff won't be eclipsed by the new and improved Donald. Nice try.
These "anonymous" sources will give the Senate an opportunity to conduct its investigation... But if they refuse, you'll see plenty of smoking guns leaked to The Post and The Times.

replies.commentBody: Flynn spoke to the Ru$$ian ambassador whose phone we tapped. If those conversations led to a FISA warrant, maybe Flynn was tapped talking to Orange Julius Caesar. One can hope.
Russia is not "tampering" with European elections. The establishment is simply using the same preemptive strategy in case they lose to LePen and Wilder, whose respective countries use paper ballots.
Trump's unsecured cellphone! We need to see ALL the calls dialed and received in the last 18 months!!!!

comments.commentBody: Since Trump is reported not to use email, the trail to him from his associates would most likely be obscured.  So I think this is an important story to report even though there are no direct links to Trump named.  Particularly considering the concern that Russia is tampering with European elections.
